seriesJson.title: Fifty years of growth
seriesJson.description: A series of documentaries on industrial change in the U.S.

node.title: Seeking a human community
node.description: Sounds of people in search of an integrated life seem to lose the stability of the binding tie, but find it again in universal values.

node.title: Each according to his skill
node.description: The American character searches for health.  Efficient, modern medicine stretches life.  Social awareness joins technology in the race to meet demands.

node.title: The American views his life
node.description: The American character joins the search for personal satisfaction amidst the plastic nature of groups.  He penetrates change and accepts the challenge of his era.

node.title: Access to information
node.description: Time and space compress:  Communication spawns a confusion of signals - a growing impression of electronic intensity as ideas and information challenge the media.

node.title: A place for the family
node.description: Voices remember the family as it was, and talk of change seems more than just familiar.  Questions form.  Tradition and innovation combine in the living scene to shape answers.

node.title: The continuous flow
node.description: Time and space compress:  the needs of transportation test old modes of movement.  Goods, people and services in motion search for efficient solutions.

node.title: A fascination for leisure
node.description: Crowded cities, mass media at home, restless classrooms: People pursue the avenues of leisure time.  Efficient machinery changes work and produces time for play.

node.title: They live in different worlds
node.description: Communities of noise and need search for knowledge to meet the demands of mid-century life.  People prepare for a life of competition and cooperation.

node.title: With each new advancement
node.description: Problems and trends of manufacturing; workers on the job describe their experiences

node.title: Selling the consumer
node.description: Discretionary spending changes the balance between production and consumption.  The American as consumer finds new patterns of purchase in supermarket and department stores.

node.title: To find more resources
node.description: The electric intensity of a steam-electric generator symbolizes the search for more natural resources.  Demand competes with depletion; the country cries for energy, metal, land, water.

node.title: The challenge of work
node.description: Working people in the midst of industrial and social change; competition and cooperation combine on the farm, in the factory, at the desk, and behind the counter.

node.title: In search of stability
node.description: Children's laughter and choir's song transcend the social shuffle of mid-century America.  Urban tensions and rural heritage create re-evaluations and new patterns.
